Other remedies are pounded plantain and tithymallus cliaracites. LXXIII. Remedies for dropsy are: panaces ; plantain as food, after dry bread without any drink3 two-drachma doses of betony in two cyathi of wine or honey wine; agaric, or lonchitis seed, two spoon- fuls for a dose taken in water3 psyllion in wine; juice of either anagallis3 root of cotyledon in honey wine; root of fresh ebulum, shaken only and not washed, a two-finger pinch for a dose, taken in a hemina of old wine and hot water3 root of trefoil in wine, two drachmae for a dose3 the tithymallus called platyphyllon; seed of the hypericum known as caros ; acte, which some identify with ebulum, the root, if there is no sever, being crushed in three cyathi of wine, or the seed b being· taken in dark wine; vervain also, a good handful being boiled down in water to one half. The most efficacious remedy however is believed to be the juice of chamaeacte. An outbreak ⁶ of phlegm is relieved by plantain, by cyclamen root in honey, and by pounded leaves of ebulum in old wine. An application of the last cures boad also, an eruption of red pimples‚ and the juice of strychnos applied as liniment cures itch.
